x10.glb

Class Context<Queue,R>

  • x10.glb.Context<Queue,R>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Any, ContextI

    public class Context<Queue,R>
implements ContextI
    Declaration: Context[Queue, R]{Queue <: x10.glb.TaskQueue[Queue, R]} implements x10.glb.ContextI.
     Context object that can be passed to user code. User code can interact with GLB library via an Context object.
For now, the only provided method is yield() method. User can stop processing and probe the network during computation,
if necessary, by calling yield()

Modifier and Type
Method and Description

      

      
void
yield()

      Used by the user code, yield back to GLB scheduler.
      
      		

      

      
void
yielding()

      Implements the ConTextI interface, for potentially simplified usage of yield by the user code,
i.e., user doesn't have to provide type of TaskQueue and type of computation result.

      Method Detail
      




        

      • 

        yield
        

        public void yield()
        

        Used by the user code, yield back to GLB scheduler.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        yielding
        

        public void yielding()
        

        Implements the ConTextI interface, for potentially simplified usage of yield by the user code,
i.e., user doesn't have to provide type of TaskQueue and type of computation result.
However, this programming style is not adopted in this version of GLB because we might need to
expose TaskQueue, R type for the future usage.
